image.altText: Convicted sex offender Peter John van de Wetering smiling in front of a grey wall

items.synopsis: Peter van de Wetering was sentenced to nine years in jail in 2016 for his attack on the 19-year-old backpacker.

title.children: 'It could happen again': Psychiatrists testify as Queensland backpacker rapist comes up for parole

image.altText: Composite of Indian man wearing a brown fleece jacket, an Indian couple in black and white, and an apartment building.

items.synopsis: For more than a decade, Kris Agrawal built a reputation as a reliable businessman. But the shocking collapse of his empire has left more than 150 mum and dad investors almost $60 million out of pocket.

title.children: The collapse of an $80 million property investment scheme

image.altText: Greens party members Max Chandler-Mather and Adam Bandt at a press conference.

items.synopsis: The federal government's key housing policy is likely to pass parliament after an agreement was reached with the Greens.

title.children: Government's key housing policy set to pass parliament after deal with Greens

image.altText: premier gesturing as she speaks, behind a lecturn

items.synopsis: Cabinet members have had to defend the premier's leadership from chatter about dissatisfaction among Labor colleagues.

title.children: Queensland Premier 'absolutely determined' to lead Labor after rumours of dissatisfaction in party ranks

image.altText: A dark-haired man in his 30s and his mother, about 60, sit in front of a tent with their two dogs.

items.synopsis: Matt Turner has a job and perfect tenancy references, but the housing crisis has left him at his lowest point.

title.children: 'It's hard living in a tent and going to work every day': Why this employed 34yo and his mum are homeless

image.altText: A sign that reads Koumala State School with a fence and buildings behind it, blue sky, green trees.

items.synopsis: Donny Morrison, 69, died after being bitten by a snake he was uncoiling from a friend's leg at a school centenary celebrations.

title.children: Family thanks community who helped  grandfather after 'confronting' fatal eastern brown snake bite

image.altText: A man with a moustache and nose ring wearing a hat leans against a tree trunk.

items.synopsis: As Australians prepare to vote in a historic referendum, the ABC's Voice correspondent Dan Bourchier travels to the north, west and east of the country for Four Corners and finds a nation grappling with its future.

title.children: Ben was going to vote Yes to the Voice. Now he's a hard No

image.altText: A brown snake with its tongue out on a rock

items.synopsis: Experts say how you respond in the minutes after a snake bite could be the difference between life and death. It comes after the tragic death of a man bitten by a suspected brown snake while trying to save a friend in North Queensland.

title.children: Snake season has turned deadly. Here's what to do if you get bitten

image.altText: The silhouette of a man vaping.

items.synopsis: A study of more than 4,000 teenagers has found one in four have vaped, with researchers warning they are doing it in the mistaken belief it helps with stress and anxiety.

title.children: 'It shows just how pervasive vaping is among young Australians': One in four teenagers have vaped, study finds

image.altText: A middle-aged man with short, greying hair, dressed in a suit for a corporate-style headshot.

items.synopsis: Stephen Wells says he intends to do his "duty in representing the local community" if he is elected to Busselton council, but others say they are horrified by remarks he made about hiding his true views from voters.

title.children: 'Racist, sexist' council candidate insists he is a Christian, 'not a national socialist'

image.altText: Emergency personel in red hats work their way through debris of buildings.

items.synopsis: Experts say the magnitude-6.8 earthquake that has devastated Marrakech and surrounding towns happened in area known for such activity.

title.children: Morocco's earthquake was more than 500km from fault lines, but experts are not surprised

image.altText: Oxfam office

items.synopsis: With unions embedding trials of the four-day work week in industrial agreements, is this the moment the working-hour-reducing concept goes mainstream?

title.children: Four-day week enshrined in first Australian union agreement, with concept spreading

image.altText: An Indigenous boy, slightly smiling, looks at camera, neck-long curly hair, slight moustache and beard.

items.synopsis: Markyia Major, 17, from Yarrabah, near Cairns, has not had any contact with family for a month or accessed his bank account.

title.children: Police launch a major investigation into teen's disappearance as fears for his safety grow

image.altText: An illustration of a car, house, health kit and book in an opened gift box

items.synopsis: Some experts say a salary sacrifice or a salary package agreement can help maximise income and reduce tax debt — depending on the industry you're in and what your employer offers.

title.children: Ever heard of salary sacrifice? Here's what it is and how it can help reduce debt

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks to reporters shot from between shoulders.

items.synopsis: WA's Premier Roger Cook backs the state's resources industry amid revelations his predecessor Mark McGowan pressured the environmental watchdog to withdraw emissions guidance, but concedes he was not privy to the conversation.

title.children: Premier Roger Cook backs resources industry amidst 'extraordinary' Mark McGowan phone call on emissions

image.altText: A tractor with a sign that reads 'No Waste Dump' is parked in a wheat field. A rainbow is in the sky.

items.synopsis: Resources Minister Madeleine King says the Commonwealth had spent $108.6 million towards establishing the National Radioactive Waste Management Facility (NRWMF) between July 2014 and August 2023.

title.children: Federal government reveals cost of abandoned nuclear waste dump in South Australia

image.altText: Bird's eye view of cramped island nation

items.synopsis: Experts say the sea will engulf Carti Sugtupu and dozens of neighbouring islands in the Guna Yala region by the end of the century.

title.children: 'We're going to sink': Residents escape island hit by rising sea levels

image.altText: Sign of Mackay court house

items.synopsis: A 34-year-old man, who was jailed for six years for a 2021 Bruce Highway crash resulting in the death of a 60-year-old father, has today been sentenced for three additional charges.

title.children: Driver who killed father-of-three in head-on crash sentenced for additional drug charges

image.altText: A plume of smoke from a bushfire, with a dry paddock in the foreground.

items.synopsis: Fire and emergency services are working to contain a fire burning through national parkland south of Bundaberg that prompted an emergency evacuation alert earlier today.

title.children: Fire crews continue to battle blaze in national park after emergency bushfire evacuation south of Bundaberg

image.altText: Catholic Archbishop of Perth Timothy Costelloe arrives for the parliamentary inquiry hearing.

items.synopsis: A parliamentary inquiry hears Timothy Costelloe reject claims he is being "insensitive or unresponsive" as the church faces accusations it is intentionally slowing down justice for survivors of child sex abuse.

title.children: Archbishop 'horrified', 'personally shamed' by extent of abuse in Catholic institutions

image.altText: ACT coat of arms on Magistrates Court building

items.synopsis: A 34-year-old New South Wales man who told police he was selling drugs as a way of making "fast money" to pay for his father's funeral is sentenced to jail.

title.children: Sydney drug dealer who travelled to Canberra to make 'fast money' for his father's funeral sentenced to jail

image.altText: Peter Payne stands in front of a gate

items.synopsis: A magistrate calls bush solicitor Peter Payne's crime "unsophisticated" but says it crossed the line.

title.children: 'They're setting a trap for you': NSW publican-turned-lawyer convicted after helping client avoid court

image.altText: Novak Djokovic holds up his hands

items.synopsis: Novak Djokovic is 36 years old, has won more grand slam singles titles than any other man in history with 24 to his name — but incredibly, he's still learning and hungry for more.

title.children: The ominous sentence that shows newly crowned US Open champion Novak Djokovic is not done yet

image.altText: black and white photo of the exterior of the Kinchela Boys Home

items.synopsis: David Harris will meet with the Kempsey Aboriginal Land Council and Stolen Generation survivors to discuss the findings of an archaeological report into one of Australia's most notorious Aboriginal boys homes.

title.children: Meeting about ground 'anomalies' at Kinchela Aboriginal Boys Home part of 'truth-telling', minister says

image.altText: A sign saying Minerva Foods

items.synopsis: Just over 12 months after a celebrated re-opening, industry sources say Esperance's Shark Lake is unlikely to re-open, shocking farmers and workers.

title.children: WA abattoir shuts unexpectedly, leaving workers, farmers and animals in limbo

image.altText: A police vehicle and officer in front of police tape at the side of a lake

items.synopsis: A body has been recovered from Stockton Lake, near Collie, but it is yet to be formally identified, as the search for a missing 23-year-old man continues.

title.children: Body found at popular WA swimming spot amid search for missing man

image.altText: Composite Kerry Frankcombe and marine rescue personnel.

items.synopsis: Conditions were good when Kerry Frankcombe set out for a Sunday afternoon fishing trip off Tasmania's north coast, police say. But the 75-year-old has not been since, despite his boat being found with an EPIRB not activated.

title.children: Empty boat found at sea after Tasmanian man embarks on fishing trip

image.altText: AFL players playing a game

items.synopsis: Two men have been charged with assaulting police officers after spectators stormed the field at a country footy final in Queensland.

title.children: Police officers allegedly assaulted after 'disgusting' incident at outback Australian Rules grand final

image.altText: An Indigenous man and a teenager stand next to each other in playground.

items.synopsis: Some of Yardgee's players have gone from "getting into a lot of trouble" to celebrating premiership glory. But a post-game spectator brawl has cast a cloud over their success.

title.children: Footballers sick of violence ruining the game call on elders, parents to step up

image.altText: A man wearing a suit jacket and sunglasses walks outside the court building.

items.synopsis: A jury has been dismissed after hearing months of evidence in the trial of Cecil Kennedy, who prosecutors alleged had given Jordan Thompson a dose of Endep because he wanted to keep him quiet.

title.children: Jurors fail to reach verdict for man accused of giving toddler lethal dose of antidepressants

image.altText: A woman wearing a red top and a red headband, holds aloft a trophy

items.synopsis: The 19-year-old is the first teen to win the grand slam since Serena Williams in the 90s.

title.children: Two moments show the poise and pain of being judged in front of millions
